name: Titanium
description: The top level Titanium module.

properties.name: userAgent
properties.description: the user-agent string used by Titanium

properties.name: version
properties.description: the version of Titanium that is executing

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: add an event listener for the instance to receive view triggered events

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke when the event is fired

functions.name: fireEvent
functions.description: fire a synthesized event to the views listener

functions.name: include
functions.description: one or more filenames to include as if the Javascript code was written in place. This is similar to a C #include function.

functions.name: removeEventListener
functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

name: Titanium.API
description: The top level API module. The API module is mainly used for logging.

functions.name: debug

functions.name: error

functions.name: fireEvent

functions.name: info
functions.description: function for logging informational messages

functions.name: log

functions.name: removeEventListener
functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

functions.name: warn
functions.description: function for logging warning messages

name: Titanium.Analytics
description: The top level Analytics module. The Analytics module is used for transmitting developer-defined Analytics event for your application to the Appcelerator Analytics product. It can be used to augment additional context or application-specific information which can then be accessed during analysis using Analytics.

functions.name: addEvent
functions.description: send a generic event for the application session

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: event data or null if not specified. the object must be serializable as JSON

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: add an event listener for the instance to receive view triggered events

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke when the event is fired

functions.name: featureEvent
functions.description: send an analytics feature event for the application session

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: event data or null if not specified. the object must be serializable as JSON

functions.name: fireEvent
functions.description: fire a synthesized event to the views listener

functions.name: navEvent
functions.description: send an analytics nav event for the application session

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: the <tt>from</tt> location in the nav event

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: the <tt>to</tt> location in the nav event

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: event data or null if not specified. the object must be serializable as JSON

functions.name: removeEventListener
functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

functions.name: settingsEvent
functions.description: send a analytics settings event for the application session

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: event data or null if not specified. the object must be serializable as JSON

functions.name: timedEvent
functions.description: send an analytics timed event for the application session

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: the event start as a Date object

parameters.name: stop
parameters.description: the event end as a Date object

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: event data or null if not specified. the object must be serializable as JSON

functions.name: userEvent
functions.description: send an analytics user event for the application session

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: event data or null if not specified. the object must be serializable as JSON

name: Titanium.Android
description: The top level Android module. Ti.Android.currentActivity provides each context an Activity. This object cannot be created directly.

properties.name: R
properties.description: Accessor for android resources

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: add an event listener for the instance to receive view triggered events

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke when the event is fired

functions.name: createIntent
functions.description: Create a Titanium.Android.Intent. Used to start other Activities and for marshaling data.

functions.name: createIntentChooser
functions.description: Display chooser interface to allow selection of desired target.

functions.name: createService
functions.description: Create a Titanium.Android.Service so you can start/stop it and listen for events from it.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: A Titanium.Android.Intent object created with Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent which specifies the service to be instantiated.

functions.name: createServiceIntent
functions.description: Create an Intent to be used to start a Service.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: Options dictionary -- pass in a <tt>url</tt> option to specify the path to a javascript-based service you create.

functions.name: fireEvent
functions.description: fire a synthesized event to the views listener

functions.name: isServiceRunning
functions.description: Check on state of Service.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: A Titanium.Android.Intent object created with Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent which specifies the service to check.

functions.name: removeEventListener
functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

functions.name: startService
functions.description: Start a simple service

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: A Titanium.Android.Intent object created with Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent which specifies the service to start.

functions.name: stopService
functions.description: Stop a simple service that was started with startService.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: A Titanium.Android.Intent object created with Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent which specifies the service to stop.

name: Titanium.Android.Activity
description: The Titanium binding of an Android Activity

properties.name: intent
properties.description: The Intent that was used to start this Activity

properties.name: onCreateOptionsMenu
properties.description: A callback function that is called to initially create an Android Options Menu for this Activity when the user presses the Menu button. See the menu examples in Titanium.Android.Menu

properties.name: onPrepareOptionsMenu
properties.description: A callback function that is called to prepare an Options Menu for displaying on this Activity when the user presses the Menu button. See the menu examples in Titanium.Android.Menu

properties.name: requestedOrientation
properties.description: The requested orientation of this Activity. See possible constant values that begin with SCREEN_ORIENTATION in the Titanium.Android module.

functions.name: getIntent
functions.description: Returns the Titanium.Android.Intent that was used to start this Activity.

functions.name: getString
functions.description: Get an Android or Application string using the passed-in Resource ID and optional format arguments. Also see Android's documentation for getString and String Resources

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: A Resource ID from the Application or Android.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Optional format arguments for the String resource

functions.name: setRequestedOrientation
functions.description: Set the requested Activity orientation. Also see Android's documentation for setRequestedOrientation

functions.name: setResult
functions.description: Sets the result of this Activity using an Intent. This should be used in the case when the Activity responds to startActivityForResult. Also see Android's documentation for setResult

parameters.name: resultCode
parameters.description: The result code for this Activity. Must be one of Titanium.Android.RESULT_OK, Titanium.Android.RESULT_CANCELED, Titanium.Android.RESULT_FIRST_USER

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: An optional Titanium.Android.Intent with extra result data

functions.name: startActivity
functions.description: Starts a new Activity, using the passed in Intent as the description. Also see Android's documentation for startActivity

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: Description of the Activity to start

functions.name: startActivityForResult
functions.description: The same as startActivity, but also accepts a callback function for handling the result of the started Activity. Also see Android's documentation for startActivityForResult

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: Description of the Activity to start

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A callback function that is executed when the Activity has set it's result. See example in Titanium.Android.Activity.

name: Titanium.Android.Calendar

properties.name: METHOD_EMAIL
properties.description: constant for the Titanium.Android.Calendar.Reminder method property.

properties.name: METHOD_SMS
properties.description: constant for the Titanium.Android.Calendar.Reminder method property.

properties.name: STATE_DISMISSED

properties.name: STATE_SCHEDULED

properties.name: STATUS_TENTATIVE

properties.name: VISIBILITY_CONFIDENTIAL

properties.name: VISIBILITY_PRIVATE

properties.name: allAlerts
properties.description: Array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Alert objects representing all alerts.

properties.name: allCalendars
properties.description: Array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Calendar objects representing all the calendars known to the native calendar app.

properties.name: selectableCalendars
properties.description: Array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Calendar objects representing calendars selected within the native calendar app. This may be a subset of allCalendars; for example, the native calendar application may know -- via your Gooogle account -- about calendars that you have access to but have not selected to be displayed in the native calendar app.

name: Titanium.Android.Calendar.Alert
description: An object which represents a single alert for an event in an Android calendar.

properties.name: alarmTime
properties.description: The date/time at which the alert's alarm is triggered.

properties.name: begin
properties.description: The date/time at which the corresponding event begins.

properties.name: end
properties.description: The date/time at which the corresponding event ends.

properties.name: eventId
properties.description: The integer id of the event for which the alert is set.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The id of the alert.

properties.name: minutes
properties.description: The minutes before the event when the alert should trigger.

properties.name: state
properties.description: The current state of the alert. Possible values are the STATE_ constants in Titanium.Android.Calendar.

name: Titanium.Android.Calendar.Calendar
description: An object which represents a single calendar in Android.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: Whether the calendar is hidden.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The id of the calendar.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The display name of the calendar.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Whether the calendar is selected.

functions.name: createEvent
functions.description: Add an event to the calendar. Returns the created Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: An object defining the properties of the event. These correspond to properties of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event.

functions.name: getEventById
functions.description: Returns the Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event object for the event with the given integer id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The integer id of the event to return.

functions.name: getEventsBetweenDates
functions.description: Returns an array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event objects with all events in the given date range.

functions.name: getEventsInDate
functions.description: Returns an array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event objects with all events on the given date.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year of the desired date.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month of the desired date.  The month is zero-based, therefore January is 0 and December is 11.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The day for which events should be returned.

functions.name: getEventsInMonth
functions.description: Returns an array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event objects with all events in the given month.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year of the desired month.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month for which events should be returned.  The month is zero-based, therefore January is 0 and December is 11.

functions.name: getEventsInYear
functions.description: Returns an array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event objects with all events in the given year.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year for which all events should be returned.

name: Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event
description: An object which represents a single event in an Android calendar.

properties.name: alerts
properties.description: An array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Alert objects which are the alerts - if any - for this event.

properties.name: allDay
properties.description: Whether the event is all day.

properties.name: begin
properties.description: The date/time at which the event begins.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The event description.

properties.name: end
properties.description: The date/time at which the event ends.

properties.name: extendedProperties
properties.description: An object containing extended properties of the event.

properties.name: hasAlarm
properties.description: Whether an alarm is scheduled for the event.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The id of the event.

properties.name: location
properties.description: The event location.

properties.name: reminders
properties.description: An array of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Reminder objects which are the reminders - if any - for this event.

properties.name: status
properties.description: The status of the event. Possible values are the STATUS constants in Titanium.Android.Calendar.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title string for the event.

properties.name: visibility
properties.description: The event's visibility. Possible values are the VISIBILITY constants in Titanium.Android.Calendar.

functions.name: createAlert
functions.description: create an alert for this event. Pass a dictionary object containing attributes corresponding to properties of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Alert. Returns the created alert.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Properties for the new alert, corresponding to properties of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Alert.

functions.name: createReminder
functions.description: create a reminder for this event. Pass a dictionary object containing attributes corresponding to properties of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Reminder. Returns the created Reminder.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Properties for the new reminder, corresponding to properties of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Reminder.

functions.name: getExtendedProperty
functions.description: Returns the value of the given extended property key string.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the extended property whose value should be returned.

functions.name: setExtendedProperty
functions.description: Set the value of the named extended property.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the extended property whose value should be set.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to which to set the named extended property.

name: Titanium.Android.Calendar.Reminder
description: An object which represents a single reminder for an event in an Android calendar. Reminders should not be created directly, but rather by using the createReminder method of Titanium.Android.Calendar.Event.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The id of the reminder.

properties.name: method
properties.description: The reminder method. Possible values are the METHOD constants in Titanium.Android.Calendar.

properties.name: minutes
properties.description: The minutes before the event when the reminder should occur.

name: Titanium.Android.Service
description: The Titanium binding of an Android Service. Can be used to start/stop the service directly and listen for service-specific events. In the Javascript-based services you write, this can be referenced with Titanium.Android.currentService. You can create an instance of the service with Titanium.Android.createService.

properties.name: intent
properties.description: (read-only) The Titanium.Android.Intent used to start or bind to the Service.

properties.name: serviceInstanceId
properties.description: (read-only) A service can be started more than once -- this number (based on an incrementing integer) indicates which "start number" in the sequence the current service instance is.

functions.name: start
functions.description: Start the Service. Effective only if this instance of Titanium.Android.Service was created with Titanium.Android.createService.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Stop this running instance of the Service.

parameters.description: dictionary of key/values that are used to create the notification. the <tt>date</tt> property is when the notification should fire, <tt>repeat</tt> is an optional property of one of: <tt>weekly</tt>, <tt>daily</tt>, <tt>yearly,</tt> <tt>monthly</tt>, <tt>alertBody</tt> is an optional property that is the body of the alert when the notification is displayed, <tt>alertAction</tt> is an optional property that represents the alert button text or the 'slide to unlock...' slider in place of unlock, <tt>alertLaunchImage</tt> is an optional property that specifies the launch image to display instead of Default.png when launching the application, <tt>badge</tt> is the optional badge value for the application, <tt>sound</tt> is the optional property to specify the sound to play when the notification is triggered and <tt>userInfo</tt> is the optional property which specifies data passed to the application upon launch when the notification is triggered.

name: Titanium.Contacts.Person
description: An object which represents a person in the contacts database.

properties.name: URL
properties.description: URLs of webpages associated with the person. Multi-value, valid labels are: home, work, other, homepage. Values are strings.

properties.name: address
properties.description: The addresses for the person. Multi-value, valid labels are: home, work, other. Values are dictionaries.

properties.name: birthday
properties.description: The birthday of the person. Single value, format is "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'.'SSS+0000"

properties.name: created
properties.description: The date the person was created in the database. Single value, format is "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'.'SSS+0000", read-only

properties.name: date
properties.description: Dates associated with the person. Multi-value, valid labels are: anniversary. Values are strings of format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'.'SSS+0000"

properties.name: department
properties.description: The department of the person. Single value

properties.name: email
properties.description: The email addresses for the person. Multi-value, valid labels are: home, work, other. Values are strings.

properties.name: firstName
properties.description: The first name of the person. Single value

properties.name: firstPhonetic
properties.description: The phonetic first name of the person. Single value

properties.name: fullName
properties.description: The localized full name of the person. Single value, read-only

properties.name: image
properties.description: A blob object representing the image for the person. Set to null to remove the image. Single value

properties.name: instantMessage
properties.description: The instant messenger names for the person. Multi-value, valid labels are: aim, icq, jabber, msn, yahoo. Values are dictionaries.

properties.name: jobTitle
properties.description: The job title of the person. Single value

properties.name: kind
properties.description: The kind of person. Single value, one of Titanium.Contacts.CONTACTS_KIND_PERSON or Titanium.Contacts.CONTACTS_KIND_ORGANIZATION

properties.name: lastName
properties.description: The last name of the person. Single value

properties.name: lastPhonetic
properties.description: The phonetic last name of the person. Single value

properties.name: middleName
properties.description: The middle name of the person. Single value

properties.name: middlePhonetic
properties.description: The phonetic middle name of the person. Single value

properties.name: modified
properties.description: The most recent date the person was modified. Single value, format is "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'.'SSS+0000", read-only

properties.name: nickname
properties.description: The nickname of the person. Single value

properties.name: note
properties.description: Notes for the person. Single value

properties.name: organization
properties.description: The organization the person belongs to. Single value

properties.name: phone
properties.description: The phone numbers for the person. Multi-value, valid labels are: home, work, other, mobile, pager, workFax, homeFax, main, iPhone. Values are strings.

properties.name: prefix
properties.description: The prefix for the person. Single value

properties.name: relatedNames
properties.description: The names of people the person is related to. Multi-value, valid labels are: mother, father, parent, sister, brother, child, friend, spouse, partner, manager, assistant. Values are strings.

properties.name: suffix
properties.description: The suffix for the person. Single value

properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image url of the view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: the border color of the view

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: the border radius of the view

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: the border width of the view

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: property for the view bottom position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: center
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the center of the views position relative to the parent view

properties.name: left
properties.description: property for the view left position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: right

properties.name: size

properties.name: softKeyboardOnFocus
properties.description: One of Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS, Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS, or Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS. (Android only)

properties.name: top

properties.description: a boolean indicating if the view should receive touch events (true, default) or forward them to peers (false)

name: Titanium.Locale
description: The top level Locale module. The Locale module works with localization files to which are generated during compilation into the operating system specific localization formats. The Locale module provides locale-specific strings which can be referenced at runtime. Additionally, the module contains a few methods and properties for querying device locale information.

properties.name: currentCountry
properties.description: return the current (default) ISO 2-letter country code for the device.

properties.name: currentLanguage
properties.description: return the current language for the device based on the user's settings (readonly)

properties.name: currentLocale
properties.description: return the current locale string for the device based on the user's settings (e.g., en-US). (readonly) (Android only)

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: add an event listener for the instance to receive view triggered events

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke when the event is fired

functions.description: fire a synthesized event to the views listener

functions.name: formatTelephoneNumber
functions.description: format a telephone number according to the current locale.

functions.name: getCurrencyCode
functions.description: return a currency code for a given locale. (Android only)

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: the locale for which you want to the currency code, e.g. getCurrencyCode('en-US') -> 'USD'

functions.name: getCurrencySymbol
functions.description: return a currency symbol for the given currency code. (Android only)

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: the currency for which you want the symbol, e.g. getCurrencySymbol('USD') -> '$'

functions.name: getLocaleCurrencySymbol
functions.description: return a currency symbol for the given locale. (Android only)

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: the locale whose currency symbol you want, e.g. getLocaleCurrencySymbol('en-US') -> '$'

functions.name: getString
functions.description: return a localization string

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: the key to use when mapping into the localization file

parameters.name: hint
parameters.description: the text to use if no key found in the localization file

name: Titanium.Map.MapView
description: The MapView is an object created by Titanium.Map.createView and is used for embedding native mapping capabilities as a view in your application. With native maps, you can control the mapping location, the type of map, the zoom level and you can add custom annotations directly to the map.

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: annotations
properties.description: an array of annotations to add to the map

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: the background color of the view

properties.name: backgroundDisabledColor
properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image url of the view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: the border color of the view

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: the border radius of the view

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: the border width of the view

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: property for the view bottom position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: center
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the center of the views position relative to the parent view

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Set true if you want a view to be focusable when navigating with the trackball or D-Pad. Default: false. (Android Only)

properties.name: font-family
properties.description: the font family

properties.name: font-size
properties.description: the font size

properties.name: font-style
properties.description: the font style, either normal or italics

properties.name: font-weight
properties.description: the font weight, either normal or bold

properties.name: height
properties.description: property for the view height. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: left
properties.description: property for the view left position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: location
properties.description: a dictionary that specifies the following properties specifying the region location to set the map: latitudeDelta, longitudeDelta, latitude, longitude.

properties.name: mapType
properties.description: the map type constant of either Titanium.Map.STANDARD_TYPE, Titanium.Map.SATELLITE_TYPE or Titanium.Map.HYBRID_TYPE.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: region
properties.description: a dictionary that specifies the following properties specifying the region location to set the map: latitudeDelta, longitudeDelta, latitude, longitude.

properties.name: regionFit
properties.description: boolean to indicate if the map should attempt to fit the map view into the region in the visible view

properties.name: right
properties.description: property for the view right position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: size
properties.description: the size of the view as a dictionary of width and height properties

properties.name: softKeyboardOnFocus
properties.description: One of Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS, Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS, or Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS. (Android only)

properties.name: top
properties.description: property for the view top position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: touchEnabled
properties.description: a boolean indicating if the view should receive touch events (true, default) or forward them to peers (false)

properties.name: transform
properties.description: the transformation matrix to apply to the view

properties.name: userLocation
properties.description: boolean to indicate if the map should show the user's current device location as a pin on the map

properties.name: visible
properties.description: a boolean of the visibility of the view

properties.name: width
properties.description: property for the view width. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description: the z index position relative to other sibling views

properties.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_AMBIENT
properties.description: For long-duration sounds such as rain, car engine noise, and so on. It is also for 'play along' style applications, such a virtual piano that a user plays over iPod audio.

properties.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_PLAYBACK
properties.description: For playing recorded music or other sounds that are central to the successful use of your application. When using this mode, your application audio continues with the Ring/Silent switch set to silent or when the screen locks. This property normally disallows iPod audio to mix with application audio

properties.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_PLAY_AND_RECORD
properties.description: Allows recording (input) and playback (output) of audio, such as for a VOIP (voice over IP) application. This category is appropriate for simultaneous recording and playback, and also for applications that record and play back but not simultaneously. If you want to ensure that sounds such as Messages alerts do not play while your application is recording, use Titanium.Media.AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_RECORD instead. This category normally disallows iPod audio to mix with application audio.

properties.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_RECORD
properties.description: For recording audio; it silences playback audio.

properties.name: AUDIO_SESSION_MODE_SOLO_AMBIENT
properties.description: The solo ambient sound category is for long-duration sounds such as rain, car engine noise, and so on. When you use this category, audio from built-in applications, such as the iPod, is silenced. Your audio is silenced when the Ring/Silent switch is set to silent or when the screen locks.

properties.name: VIDEO_SCALING_ASPECT_FILL
properties.description: constant for video aspect where the movie will be scaled until the movie fills the entire screen. Content at the edges of the larger of the two dimensions is clipped so that the other dimension fits the screen exactly. The aspect ratio of the movie is preserved.

properties.name: VIDEO_SCALING_ASPECT_FIT
properties.description: constant for video aspect fit where the movie will be scaled until one dimension fits on the screen exactly. In the other dimension, the region between the edge of the movie and the edge of the screen is filled with a black bar. The aspect ratio of the movie is preserved.

properties.name: VIDEO_SCALING_MODE_FILL
properties.description: constant for video aspect where the movie will be scaled until both dimensions fit the screen exactly. The aspect ratio of the movie is not preserved.

properties.name: VIDEO_SCALING_NONE
properties.description: constant for video scaling where the scaling is turn off. The movie will not be scaled.

properties.description: the video source type is a file. Related to the sourceType property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer

properties.description: the video source type is a remote stream. Related to the sourceType property of Titanium.Media.VideoPlayer

properties.description: use the exact time

functions.name: openPhotoGallery
functions.description: open the photo gallery picker

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: pass a dictionary with the following supported keys: <tt>success</tt> a function that will be called when the camera is completed, <tt>error</tt> a function that will be called upon receiving an error, <tt>cancel</tt> a function that will be called if the user presses the cancel button, <tt>autohide</tt> boolean if the camera should auto hide after the media capture is completed (defaults to true), <tt>animated</tt> boolean if the dialog should be animated (defaults to true) upon showing and hiding, <tt>saveToPhotoGallery</tt> boolean if the media should be saved to the photo gallery upon successful capture, <tt>allowEditing</tt> boolean if the media should be editable after capture in the UI interface, <tt>mediaTypes</tt> an array of media type constants supported by the capture device UI, <tt>showControls</tt> boolean to indicate if the built-in UI controls should be displayed, <tt>overlay</tt> view which is added as an overlay to the UI (on top), <tt>transform</tt> an transformation matrix that applies to the UI transform. For iPad, <tt>popoverView</tt> can be provided to position the photo gallery popover a specific view and <tt>arrowDirection</tt> can be provided to control the type of arrow and position of the gallery.

functions.name: removeEventListener
functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

functions.name: saveToPhotoGallery
functions.description: save media to photo gallery / camera roll

parameters.name: media
parameters.description: save the media passed to the cameras photo roll/media gallery. must be one of Blob object or File object or an error will be generated.

parameters.name: callbacks
parameters.description: pass a dictionary with the following supported keys: <tt>success</tt> a function that will be called when the save succeeds, and <tt>error</tt> a function that will be called upon anreceiving an error

functions.name: showCamera
functions.description: show the camera

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: pass a dictionary with the following supported keys: <tt>success</tt> a function that will be called when the camera is completed, <tt>error</tt> a function that will be called upon receiving an error, <tt>cancel</tt> a function that will be called if the user presses the cancel button, <tt>autohide</tt> boolean if the camera should auto hide after the media capture is completed (defaults to true), <tt>animated</tt> boolean if the dialog should be animated (defaults to true) upon showing and hiding, <tt>saveToPhotoGallery</tt> boolean if the media should be saved to the photo gallery upon successful capture, <tt>allowEditing</tt> boolean if the media should be editable after capture in the UI interface, <tt>mediaTypes</tt> an array of media type constants supported by the capture device UI, <tt>videoMaximumDuration</tt> float duration on how long in milliseconds to allow capture before completing, <tt>videoQuality</tt> constant to indicate the video quality during capture, <tt>showControls</tt> boolean to indicate if the built-in UI controls should be displayed, <tt>overlay</tt> view which is added as an overlay to the camera UI (on top), <tt>transform</tt> an transformation matrix that applies to the camera UI transform.

functions.name: showMusicLibrary
functions.description: show the music library. iPhone and iPad only.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: pass a dictionary with the following supported keys: <tt>success</tt> a function that will be called when the camera is completed, <tt>error</tt> a function that will be called upon receiving an error, <tt>cancel</tt> a function that will be called if the user presses the cancel button, <tt>autohide</tt> boolean if the library listing should auto hide after selection is completed (defaults to true), <tt>animated</tt> boolean if the dialog should be animated (defaults to true) upon showing and hiding, <tt>mediaTypes</tt> an array of media type constants defining selectable media (see MUSIC_MEDIA_TYPE_* properties below) as either an array or a bitwise-or single value, <tt>allowMultipleSelections</tt> boolean whether or not more than one media selection is allowed

description: The VideoPlayer object is returned by Titanium.Media.createVideoPlayer and is useful for playing videos.

properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: autoplay
properties.description: indicates if a movie should automatically start playback when it is likely to finish uninterrupted based on e.g. network conditions. Defaults to true.

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: background color for the view. deprecated, set the background color on the view.

properties.name: backgroundDisabledColor
properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image url of the view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: the border color of the view

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: the border radius of the view

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: the border width of the view

properties.name: left
properties.description: property for the view left position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.description: deprecated in 3.2+ of the iPhone SDK - use mediaControlStyle. Provides the ability to set the control mode of the movie player. Defaults to Titanium.Media.VIDEO_CONTROL_DEFAULT.

properties.name: naturalSize
properties.description: returns a dictionary with properties width and height. Returns the natural size of the movie or 0 for both properties if not known or applicable.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: playableDuration
properties.description: The currently playable duration of the movie, for progressively downloaded network content.

properties.name: playbackState
properties.description: Returns the current playback state of the music player

properties.name: playing

properties.name: repeatMode
properties.description: Determines how the movie player repeats when reaching the end of playback. Defaults to Titanium.Media.VIDEO_REPEAT_MODE_NONE.

properties.name: right
properties.description: property for the view right position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: scalingMode
properties.description: Determines how the content scales to fit the view. Defaults to Titanium.Media.VIDEO_SCALING_ASPECT_FIT.

properties.name: size

properties.name: softKeyboardOnFocus
properties.description: One of Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS, Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS, or Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS. (Android only)

properties.name: sourceType
properties.description: The playback type of the movie. Defaults to Titanium.Media.VIDEO_SOURCE_TYPE_UNKNOWN. Specifying a playback type before playing the movie can result in faster load times.

properties.name: top

properties.name: transform

properties.description: Indicates if the movie player should inherit the application's audio session instead of creating a new session (which would interrupt the application's session). Defaults to true. Setting this property during playback will not take effect until playback is stopped and started again.

properties.name: NETWORK_UNKNOWN
properties.description: constant value to indicate that the network is not known

properties.name: NETWORK_WIFI
properties.description: constant value to indicate that the network is WIFI

properties.name: NOTIFICATION_TYPE_ALERT
properties.description: constant value for the push notification alert type

properties.name: NOTIFICATION_TYPE_BADGE
properties.description: constant value for the push notification badge type

properties.name: NOTIFICATION_TYPE_SOUND
properties.description: constant value for the push notification sound type

properties.name: READ_MODE
properties.description: constant value specifying read-only mode for sockets

properties.name: READ_WRITE_MODE
properties.description: constant value specifying read-write mode for sockets

properties.name: WRITE_MODE
properties.description: constant value specifying write-only mode for sockets

properties.name: networkType
properties.description: the network type value as a constant.

properties.name: networkTypeName
properties.description: the network type name constant. Returns one of NONE, WIFI, LAN or MOBILE.

properties.name: online
properties.description: readonly boolean value that indicates if the network is reachable to the Internet either via WIFI or Carrier network

properties.name: remoteDeviceUUID
properties.description: the remote device UUID if the device was registered with the Apple Push Notification Service or null if not set. Only available on iPhone.

properties.name: remoteNotificationTypes
properties.description: returns an array of network type constants enabled for the application. Only available on iPhone.

properties.name: remoteNotificationsEnabled
properties.description: returns true if remote notifications have been enabled. Only available on iPhone.

functions.name: addConnectivityListener
functions.description: adds a connectivity listener to listen for network changes. This method has been deprecated in favor of listening for a change event.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke upon network connectivity changes

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: add an event listener for the instance to receive view triggered events

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke when the event is fired

functions.name: createBonjourBrowser
functions.description: create and return an instance of Titanium.Network.BonjourBrowser

parameters.name: serviceType
parameters.description: service to search for, must include the protocol type suffix (._tcp)

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: the Bonjour service domain to conduct the search in.  Default value is 'local.'

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: (optional) a dictionary object properties defined in Titanium.Network.BonjourBrowser

functions.name: createBonjourService
functions.description: create and return an instance of Titanium.Network.BonjourService

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: the name of the service.  Must be a unique identifier for this service type and domain.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: the type of service.  Must include the protocol identifier (._tcp)

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: the domain to publish the service in.  Default value is 'local.'

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: (optional) a dictionary object properties defined in Titanium.Network.BonjourService

functions.name: createHTTPClient
functions.description: create and return an instance of Titanium.Network.HTTPClient

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: (optional) a dictionary object properties defined in Titanium.Network.HTTPClient

functions.name: createTCPSocket
functions.description: create and return an instance of Titanium.Network.TCPSocket

parameters.name: hostName
parameters.description: the host name to connect to/listen on

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: (optional) a dictionary object properties defined in Titanium.Network.TCPSocket

functions.name: decodeURIComponent
functions.description: decode a URI component part using URI encoding

functions.name: encodeURIComponent
functions.description: encode a URI component part using URI encoding

functions.name: fireEvent
functions.description: fire a synthesized event to the views listener

functions.name: registerForPushNotifications
functions.description: register for push notifications with the Apple Push Notification Service. Only available on iPhone.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: dictionary of the following: <tt>types</tt> is an array of type constants that the application would like to receive, <tt>success</tt> is a callback function that is called when the push registration is successfully completed, <tt>error</tt> is a callback function that is called when an error is received during registration and <tt>callback</tt> is a callback function that is invoked upon receiving a new push notification. This method should be called at application startup.

functions.name: removeConnectivityListener
functions.description: removes a connectivity listener. This method has been deprecated in favor of listening for a change event.

functions.name: removeEventListener
functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

name: Titanium.Network.BonjourBrowser
description: The BonjourBrowser instance returned from Titanium.Network.createBonjourBrowser. This object is a browser for the discovery and retrieval of Bonjour services available on the network.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: The domain the browser is searching in

properties.name: isSearching
properties.description: Whether or not the browser is currently searching

properties.name: serviceType
properties.description: The type of the service the browser searches for

functions.name: search
functions.description: Conduct a search for Bonjour services matching the type and domain specified during creation

functions.name: stopSearch
functions.description: Halt an ongoing search

name: Titanium.Network.BonjourService
description: The BonjourService instance returned either from Titanium.Network.createBonjourService or via the service list from a BonjourBrowser updatedServices event. This object describes a service on the network which is published by Bonjour.

properties.name: domain
properties.description: the domain of the service

properties.name: isLocal
properties.description: whether or not the service is local to the device

properties.name: name
properties.description: the name of the service

properties.name: socket
properties.description: the TCPSocket object that is used to connect to the service

properties.name: type
properties.description: the type of the service

functions.name: publish
functions.description: Publish a Bonjour service to the network. Only works if isLocal is TRUE

parameters.name: socket
parameters.description: a TCPSocket object to associate with the Bonjour service.

functions.name: resolve
functions.description: Resolve a Bonjour service from the network. Must be done before attempting to access the service's socket information, if a remote service. You cannot resolve a locally published service.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: the timeout for service resolution, in seconds.  Optional, default is 120s.

functions.name: stop
functions.description: Halts publication of a service.

name: Titanium.Network.HTTPClient
description: The HttpClient instance returned from Titanium.Network.createHTTPClient. This object (mostly) implements the XMLHttpRequest specification.

properties.name: DONE
properties.description: the DONE readyState constant

properties.name: HEADERS_RECEIVED
properties.description: the HEADERS_RECEIVED readyState constant

properties.name: LOADING
properties.description: the LOADING readyState constant

properties.name: OPENED
properties.description: the OPENED readyState constant

properties.name: UNSENT
properties.description: the UNSET readyState constant

properties.name: connected
properties.description: boolean to indicate that the response was successful

properties.name: connectionType
properties.description: the connection type, normally either GET or POST.

properties.name: file
properties.description: file to download contents to. Can only be set after calling open. iOS only

properties.name: location
properties.description: the absolute URL of the request

properties.name: ondatastream
properties.description: set this to a function before calling open to cause the function to be called at regular intervals as the request data is being received. the progress property of the event will contain a value from 0.0-1.0 with the progress.

properties.name: onerror
properties.description: set this to a function before calling open to cause the function to be called upon a error response

properties.name: onload
properties.description: set this to a function before calling open to cause the function to be called upon a successful response

properties.name: onreadystatechange
properties.description: set this to a function before calling open to cause the function to be called for each readyState change

properties.name: onsendstream
properties.description: set this to a function before calling open to cause the function to be called at regular intervals as the request data is being transmitted. the progress property of the event will contain a value from 0.0-1.0 with the progress.

properties.name: readyState
properties.description: the readyState value

properties.name: responseData
properties.description: the response data as a Blob object.

properties.name: responseText
properties.description: the response as text or null if an error was received or no data was returned

properties.name: responseXML
properties.description: the response object as an XML DOMDocument object. returns null if the content type returned by the server was not XML or the content could not be parsed

properties.name: status
properties.description: the response HTTP status code

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: timeout is milliseconds when the connection should be aborted

properties.name: validatesSecureCertificate
properties.description: set this to control how SSL certification validation is performed on connection. defaults to false if in simulator or device testing and true if release for distribution mode.

functions.name: abort
functions.description: abort a pending request

functions.name: getResponseHeader
functions.description: return the response header.

functions.name: open
functions.description: open the request and ready the connection

parameters.name: async
parameters.description: optional property to indicate if asynchronous (default) or not

functions.name: send
functions.description: send the request

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: the data to send in the request. can either be null, dictionary, string, File object or Blob.

functions.name: setRequestHeader
functions.description: set the request header. Must be called after open but before send.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: value of the header. May be null to clearing out a property, such as X-Requested-With

functions.name: setTimeout
functions.description: set the request timeout

name: Titanium.Network.TCPSocket
description: The TCPSocket instance returned from Titanium.Network.createTCPSocket. This object represents a socket which either listens locally on the device for connections, or connects to a remote machine.

properties.name: hostName
properties.description: the host name to connect to. Must be Titanium.Network.INADDR_ANY or an identifier for the local device in order to listen

properties.name: isValid
properties.description: whether or not the socket is valid

properties.name: mode
properties.description: the socket's mode

properties.name: port
properties.description: the port to connect/listen on

properties.name: stripTerminator
properties.description: strip terminating null character when sending string data; default is false

functions.name: close
functions.description: close the socket

functions.name: connect
functions.description: connect the scocket to a TCP server

functions.name: listen
functions.description: set up the socket to receive connections

functions.name: write
functions.description: write data to the socket, if the mode is WRITE_MODE or READ_WRITE_MODE

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: either a string or blob object representing the data to be transferred

parameters.name: sendTo
parameters.description: the socket reference to send the data to.  Default is to send to all connected sockets

name: Titanium.Platform
description: The top level Platform module. The Platform module is used accessing the device's platform related functionality.

properties.name: BATTERY_STATE_CHARGING
properties.description: the device is plugged in and currently being charged

properties.name: BATTERY_STATE_FULL
properties.description: the battery is fully charged

properties.name: BATTERY_STATE_UNKNOWN
properties.description: the battery state is unknown or not monitoring is not enabled

properties.name: BATTERY_STATE_UNPLUGGED
properties.description: the device is unplugged

properties.name: address
properties.description: the ip address that the device reports (only applicable on WIFI network)

properties.name: architecture
properties.description: the processor architecture that the device reports

properties.name: availableMemory
properties.description: return the amount of memory available on the device in bytes

properties.name: batteryLevel
properties.description: the current device battery level. this property is only accessible if batteryMonitoring is enabled. on iPhone, this level only changes at 5% intervals.

properties.name: batteryMonitoring
properties.description: boolean to indicate if battery monitoring is enabled

properties.name: batteryState
properties.description: constant that represents the state of the battery. this property is only accessible if batteryMonitoring is enabled

properties.name: displayCaps
properties.description: return the DisplayCaps object for platform

properties.name: id
properties.description: the unique id of the device

properties.name: locale
properties.description: the primary language of the device that the user has enabled

properties.name: macaddress
properties.description: this property will return a unique identifier for the device

properties.name: model
properties.description: the model of the phone that the device reports

properties.name: name
properties.description: the name of the platform returned by the device

properties.name: netmask
properties.description: the network mask that the device reports (only applicable on WIFI network)

properties.name: osname
properties.description: the shortname of the operating system. for example, on an iPhone, will return iphone, iPad will return ipad and Android will return android.

properties.name: ostype
properties.description: the OS architecture, such as 32 bit

properties.name: processorCount
properties.description: the number of processors the device reports

properties.name: username
properties.description: the username of the device, if set

properties.name: version
properties.description: the version of the platform returned by the device

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: add an event listener for the instance to receive view triggered events

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke when the event is fired

functions.name: canOpenURL
functions.description: returns whether or not a system URL can be opened. iOS only

functions.name: createUUID
functions.description: create a globally unique identifier

functions.name: fireEvent
functions.description: fire a synthesized event to the views listener

functions.name: openURL
functions.description: open a URL in the system default manner

functions.name: removeEventListener
functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

name: Titanium.Platform.DisplayCaps
description: The Display Caps object returned by the Titanium.Platform.displayCaps property.

properties.name: density
properties.description: returns the density property of the display device.

properties.name: dpi
properties.description: the DPI of the display device.

properties.name: platformHeight
properties.description: the height of the device screen

properties.name: platformWidth
properties.description: the width of the device screen

name: Titanium.UI
description: The main Titanium.UI module. The UI module is responsible for native user-interface components and interaction inside Titanium. The goal of the UI module is to provide a native experience along with native performance by compiling Javascript code into their native counterparts as part of the build process.

name: Titanium.UI.2DMatrix
description: The 2DMatrix is created by Titanium.UI.create2DMatrix. The 2D Matrix is an object for holding values for an affine transformation matrix. A 2D matrix is used to rotate, scale, translate, or skew the objects in a two-dimensional space. A 2D matrix is represented by a 3 by 3 matrix. Because the third column is always (0,0,1), the data structure contains values for only the first two columns.

functions.name: addEventListener
functions.description: add an event listener for the instance to receive view triggered events

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: callback function to invoke when the event is fired

functions.name: fireEvent
functions.description: fire a synthesized event to the views listener

functions.name: invert
functions.description: Returns a matrix constructed by inverting an existing matrix

functions.name: multiply
functions.description: Returns a matrix constructed by combining two existing matrix.

parameters.name: t2
parameters.description: The second matrix. This matrix is concatenated to the matrix instance against which the function is invoked.  The result of this function is the first matrix multiplied by the second matrix. You might perform several multiplications in order to create a single matrix that contains the cumulative effects of several transformations. Note that matrix operations are not commutative - the order in which you concatenate matrices is important. That is, the result of multiplying matrix t1 by matrix t2 does not necessarily equal the result of multiplying matrix t2 by matrix t1.

parameters.name: sx
parameters.description: The value by which to scale x values of the matrix

parameters.name: sy

functions.name: translate
functions.description: Returns a matrix constructed by translating an existing matrix

parameters.name: tx

parameters.name: ty
parameters.description: The value by which to move y values with the matrix

name: Titanium.UI.3DMatrix
description: The 3DMatrix is created by Titanium.UI.create3DMatrix. The 3D Matrix is an object for holding values for an affine transformation matrix. A 3D matrix is used to rotate, scale, translate, or skew the objects in a three-dimensional space. A 3D matrix is represented by a 4 by 4 matrix. Because the forth column is always (0,0,1), the data structure contains values for only the first three columns.

name: Titanium.UI.Android
description: The Android specific UI capabilities. All properties, methods and events in this namespace will only work on Android related devices.

properties.name: LINKIFY_ALL
properties.description: Auto link all supported types.

properties.name: LINKIFY_EMAIL_ADDRESSES
properties.description: Auto link email addresses.

properties.name: LINKIFY_MAP_ADDRESSES
properties.description: Auto link physical addresses.

properties.name: LINKIFY_MAP_LINKS
properties.description: Convert all street addresses to clickable links

properties.name: LINKIFY_PHONE_NUMBERS
properties.description: Auto link phone numbers.

properties.name: LINKIFY_WEB_URLS
properties.description: Auto link web urls.

properties.name: SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_PAN
properties.description: Pan contents when soft keyboard is visible. Use on Activity ("heavy weight window") to suggest how the virtual keyboard should treat the window contents. Must be specified in creation options.

properties.name: SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_RESIZE
properties.description: Resize contents when soft keyboard is visible. Use on Activity ("heavy weight window") to suggest how the virtual keyboard should treat the window contents. Must be specified in creation options.

properties.name: SOFT_INPUT_ADJUST_UNSPECIFIED
properties.description: (default) If set in the AndroidManifest.xml use that setting. Otherwise, let the keyboard decided. Must be specified in creation options.

properties.name: SOFT_INPUT_STATE_HIDDEN
properties.description: Attempt to hide the soft keyboard when control receives keyboard focus.

properties.name: SOFT_INPUT_STATE_UNSPECIFIED
properties.description: Use OS default behavior for keyboard focus.

properties.name: SOFT_INPUT_STATE_VISIBLE
properties.description: Attempt to show the soft keyboard when control receives keyboard focus.

properties.name: SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS
properties.description: Use Android default soft keyboard handling. Same as not specifying a value.

properties.name: SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS
properties.description: Request hide soft keyboard on focus. Note: OS can override request.

properties.name: SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS
properties.description: Request show soft keyboard on focus. Note: OS can override request.

properties.name: SWITCH_STYLE_CHECKBOX
properties.description: Display Switch as an Android Checkbox

properties.name: SWITCH_STYLE_TOGGLEBUTTON
properties.description: Display Switch as an Android Toggle Button (default)

name: Titanium.UI.Button
description: A Button is created by the method Titanium.UI.createButton.

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: the buttons background color

properties.name: backgroundDisabledColor
properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.description: url to a button image that is drawn as the background of the button when the button is in the disabled state

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: url to a button image that is drawn as the background of the button

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: url to a button image that is drawn as the background of the button when the button is in the selected state

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: the border color of the view

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: the border radius of the view

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: the border width of the view

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: property for the view bottom position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: center
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the center of the views position relative to the parent view

properties.name: color
properties.description: the foreground color of the button text

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: boolean that indicates if the button is enabled or not

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Set true if you want a view to be focusable when navigating with the trackball or D-Pad. Default: false. (Android Only)

properties.name: font
properties.description: the font properties of the button

properties.name: font-family
properties.description: the font family

properties.name: font-size
properties.description: the font size

properties.name: font-style
properties.description: the font style, either normal or italics

properties.name: font-weight
properties.description: the font weight, either normal or bold

properties.name: height
properties.description: property for the view height. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: image
properties.description: the image to display on the button to the left of the title

properties.name: left
properties.description: property for the view left position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: right
properties.description: property for the view right position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: selectedColor
properties.description: the selected color of the button text when the button is in the selected state

properties.name: size
properties.description: the size of the view as a dictionary of width and height properties

properties.name: softKeyboardOnFocus
properties.description: One of Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS, Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS, or Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS. (Android only)

properties.name: style
properties.description: style constant for the type of button

properties.name: title
properties.description: button title

properties.name: titleid
properties.description: the key in the locale file to use for the title property

properties.name: top
properties.description: property for the view top position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: touchEnabled
properties.description: a boolean indicating if the view should receive touch events (true, default) or forward them to peers (false)

properties.name: transform
properties.description: the transformation matrix to apply to the view

properties.name: visible
properties.description: a boolean of the visibility of the view

properties.name: width
properties.description: property for the view width. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description: the z index position relative to other sibling views
