name: Titanium.UI.OptionDialog
description: The Option Dialog is created by Titanium.UI.createOptionDialog and allows you to show a modal dialog of one or more options to the user.

properties.name: androidView
properties.description: A Titanium.UI.View. Allows for arbitrary contents inside a native dialog. Works for any dialog. (Android)

properties.name: cancel
properties.description: an index to indicate which button should be the cancel button

properties.name: destructive
properties.description: the destructive button (indicated by a visual clue in the UI)

properties.name: options
properties.description: array of button names as strings

properties.name: title
properties.description: the title of the dialog

properties.name: titleid
properties.description: the key in the locale file to use for the title property

functions.name: show
functions.description: cause the dialog to become visible

name: Titanium.UI.Picker
description: A Picker is created by the method Titanium.UI.createPicker. A Picker can be used to select one or more fixed values.

properties.name: columns
properties.description: array of column values

properties.name: countDownDuration
properties.description: the duration value in milliseconds for count down timer pickers. (Note that Titanium's Android implementation does not support the countdown timer.)

properties.name: locale
properties.description: the locale used for displaying Date/Time pickers values

properties.name: minDate
properties.description: the minimum Date/Time for value for date pickers

properties.name: minuteInterval
properties.description: property to set the interval displayed by the minutes wheel (for example, 15 minutes). The interval value must be evenly divided into 60; if it is not, the default value is used. The default and minimum values are 1; the maximum value is 30. (Not currently supported on Android.)

properties.name: selectionIndicator
properties.description: for basic picker, boolean value to indicate whether the visual selection style is shown. On the iPhone, this is a blue selected bar.

properties.name: type
properties.description: the type constant for the picker. One of Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_PLAIN (default), Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_DATE_AND_TIME, Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_DATE, Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_TIME or Titanium.UI.PICKER_TYPE_COUNT_DOWN_TIMER. (Note that Titanium's Android implementation does not support the countdown timer or date+time varieties.)

properties.name: useSpinner
properties.description: (Android only, default false.) An indicator that you wish to use a non-native Android control that looks and behaves more like the iOS picker in the sense that the user selects values by spinning a wheel. (The native Android spinner is more like a conventional "dropdown".) Note that this option works both plain pickers, date pickers and time pickers. Set it preferably immediately when creating the picker, i.e., Titanium.UI.createPicker({useSpinner:true});, but definitely before .add()ing the picker to its parent.

properties.name: value
properties.description: the Date/Time value for date pickers

properties.name: visibleItems
properties.description: (Android only.) This is relevant only if you set useSpinner to true, and it is relevant only for the plain picker (not date/time). By default, the spinner-style Android picker will show 5 rows: the one in the middle which is selected, and then 2 above and below. You can set this to allow more (use an odd number to be sure the selected row is in the middle.)

functions.name: add
functions.description: add an array of rows, a single row or a column to the picker

parameters.description: add an array of rows, a single row or a column to the picker

properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image url of the view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

name: Titanium.UI.ScrollView
description: A Scroll View is used to create a scrollable region of content. Views added to the Scroll View will be scrolled based on the content size of the Scroll View. The Scroll View is created by the method Titanium.UI.createScrollView. Note: In Android, Scroll Views can only scroll in one direction, either vertical or horizontal, but not both at the same time. See the Titanium.UI.ScrollView.scrollType property

properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

name: Titanium.UI.Tab
description: A TabGroup Tab instance. Each Tab instance maintains a stack of tab windows. Only one window within in the Tab can be visible at a time. When a window is closed, either by the user or by code, the window is removed from the stack, make the previous window visible. The root tab window cannot be removed. The Tab Group is created by the method Titanium.UI.createTab.

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: the background color of the view

properties.name: backgroundDisabledColor
properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image url of the view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: badge
properties.description: the badge value for the tab group for this tab. null indicates no badge is value

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: the border color of the view

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: the border radius of the view

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: the border width of the view

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: property for the view bottom position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: center
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the center of the views position relative to the parent view

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Set true if you want a view to be focusable when navigating with the trackball or D-Pad. Default: false. (Android Only)

properties.name: font-family
properties.description: the font family

properties.name: font-size
properties.description: the font size

properties.name: font-style
properties.description: the font style, either normal or italics

properties.name: font-weight
properties.description: the font weight, either normal or bold

properties.name: height
properties.description: property for the view height. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: icon
properties.description: the icon url for the tab group for this tab

properties.name: left
properties.description: property for the view left position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: right
properties.description: property for the view right position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: size
properties.description: the size of the view as a dictionary of width and height properties

properties.name: softKeyboardOnFocus
properties.description: One of Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS, Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS, or Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS. (Android only)

properties.name: title
properties.description: the title for the tab group for this tab

properties.name: top
properties.description: property for the view top position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: touchEnabled
properties.description: a boolean indicating if the view should receive touch events (true, default) or forward them to peers (false)

properties.name: transform
properties.description: the transformation matrix to apply to the view

properties.name: visible
properties.description: a boolean of the visibility of the view

properties.name: width
properties.description: property for the view width. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: window
properties.description: the root level tab window. all tabs must have at least one root level tab window.

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description: the z index position relative to other sibling views

parameters.description: the view to remove from this views hiearchy

functions.description: remove a previously added event listener

name: Titanium.UI.TableView
description: A Table View allows you to create a scrollable table of content in a list-based fashion. The Table View is created by the method Titanium.UI.createTableView.

properties.description: true if the rows can be selected

properties.name: allowsSelectionDuringEditing
properties.description: true if the rows can be selected while editing the table (iOS Only)

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image to render in the background of the table view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap

This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: data

properties.description: allow the table view to be editable (this must be true for swipe-to-delete) (iOS Only)

properties.name: editing
properties.description: boolean to control the editing state of the table view (iOS Only)

properties.name: filterAttribute
properties.description: the filter attribute to be used when searching. this property maps to your data object or a property on the row object

properties.name: filterCaseInsensitive
properties.description: boolean to indicate if the search should be case sensitive or case insensitive (default)

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Set true if you want a view to be focusable when navigating with the trackball or D-Pad. Default: false. (Android Only)

properties.name: font-family

properties.name: font-size

properties.name: width

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description: the z index position relative to other sibling views

parameters.name: properties

name: Titanium.UI.TableViewRow
description: A TableView row object created by the method Titanium.UI.createTableViewRow.

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: the background cell color

properties.name: backgroundDisabledColor
properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background cell image

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: the border color of the view

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: the border radius of the view

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: the border width of the view

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: property for the view bottom position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: center
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the center of the views position relative to the parent view

properties.name: className
properties.description: the class name of the table. each table view cell must have a unique class name if the cell layout is different. however, use the same name for rows that have the same structural layout (even if the content is different) to provide maximum rendering performance.

properties.name: color
properties.description: default color of the row when not selected

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Set true if you want a view to be focusable when navigating with the trackball or D-Pad. Default: false. (Android Only)

properties.name: font-family
properties.description: the font family

properties.name: font-size
properties.description: the font size

properties.name: font-style
properties.description: the font style, either normal or italics

properties.name: font-weight
properties.description: the font weight, either normal or bold

properties.name: hasCheck
properties.description: render a system provided check mark in the right image area of the row cell

properties.name: hasChild
properties.description: render a system provided right arrow in the right image area of the row cell

properties.name: hasDetail
properties.description: render a system provided blue indicator icon in the right image area of the row cell

properties.name: height
properties.description: the height of the row. specify auto to calculate the row height based on the size of the child views of the row

properties.name: indentionLevel
properties.description: the indention level for the cell (defaults to 0)

properties.name: layout
properties.description: the layout algorithm to use for the layout. either absolute (default) or vertical.

properties.name: left
properties.description: property for the view left position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: leftImage
properties.description: image url to render in the left image area of the row cell

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: right
properties.description: property for the view right position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: rightImage
properties.description: image url to render in the right image area of the row cell

properties.name: selectedBackgroundColor
properties.description: the background color to render when the row cell is selected

properties.name: selectedBackgroundImage
properties.description: the background image to render when the row cell is selected

properties.name: selectedColor
properties.description: color of the row during selection

properties.name: selectionStyle
properties.description: a selection style constant to control the selection color. For iPhone, use the constants from Titanium.UI.iPhone.TableViewCellSelectionStyle

properties.name: size
properties.description: the size of the view as a dictionary of width and height properties

properties.name: softKeyboardOnFocus
properties.description: One of Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS, Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS, or Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS. (Android only)

properties.name: title
properties.description: the title cell value. do not specify if using views as children of the row

properties.name: top
properties.description: property for the view top position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: touchEnabled
properties.description: a boolean indicating if the view should receive touch events (true, default) or forward them to peers (false)

properties.name: transform
properties.description: the transformation matrix to apply to the view

properties.name: visible
properties.description: a boolean of the visibility of the view

properties.name: width
properties.description: property for the view width. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description: the z index position relative to other sibling views

name: Titanium.UI.Toolbar
description: A Toolbar is created by the method Titanium.UI.createToolbar. A Toolbar can be placed at the bottom of a window and contain buttons.

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: the background color of the view

properties.name: backgroundDisabledColor
properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image url of the view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.description: boolean to indicate if the window should be opened modal in front of other windows

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: orientationModes

properties.name: rightNavButton

properties.name: title

properties.name: titleControl
properties.description: view to show in the title area. only available in iPhone.

properties.name: titleImage
properties.description: url to a image that show in the title area. only available in iPhone.

properties.name: titlePrompt
properties.description: title prompt for the window. only available in iPhone.

properties.name: titleid

properties.name: titlepromptid

properties.name: toolbar
properties.description: array of button objects to show in the toolbar of the window. only available in iPhone. this is only valid when the window is a child of a tab.

properties.name: top

properties.name: touchEnabled
properties.description: a boolean indicating if the view should receive touch events (true, default) or forward them to peers (false)

properties.name: transform
properties.description: the transformation matrix to apply to the view

properties.name: translucent
properties.description: boolean to indicate if the nav bar is translucent. only available in iPhone.

properties.name: url

properties.name: visible
properties.description: a boolean of the visibility of the view

properties.name: width
properties.description: property for the view width. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description: the z index position relative to other sibling views

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor

properties.name: backgroundTopCap

This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

name: Titanium.UI.iPad
description:
The iPad specific UI capabilities. All properties, methods and events in this namespace will only work on the Apple iPad related devices. To develop for iPad, you will need the Apple iPhone SDK 3.2 or later and Titanium Mobile SDK 1.2 or later.

For iPad UI programming guidelines, please review the iPad Human Interface Guidelines.

name: Titanium.UI.iPad.Popover
description: A Popover is used to manage the presentation of content in a popover. You use popovers to present information temporarily but in a way that does not take over the entire screen like a modal view does. The popover content is layered on top of your existing content in a special type of window. The popover remains visible until the user taps outside of the popover window or you explicitly dismiss it. The Popover is created by the method Titanium.UI.iPad.createPopover.

parameters.name: options
parameters.description: dictionary of the following properties: <tt>rect</tt>, <tt>animated</tt> and <tt>view</tt>. The <tt>view</tt> property should specify the view relative to where the popover should display.  <tt>animated</tt> is a boolean indicating if the showing of the popover should be animated, defaults to true. The property <tt>rect</tt> is a dictionary with the following properties: <tt>x</tt>, <tt>y</tt>, <tt>width</tt> and <tt>height</tt>, where the rectangle in <tt>view</tt> at which to anchor the popover.

name: Titanium.UI.iPad.SplitWindow
description: A SplitWindow is a window that manages the presentation of two side-by-side view controllers. You use this class to implement a master-detail interface, in which the left-side view presents a list of items and the right-side presents details of the selected item. The SplitView is for use exclusively on iPad devices. The SplitWindow is created by the method Titanium.UI.iPad.createSplitWindow.

description: The iPhone/iPad specific UI capabilities. All properties, methods and events in this namespace will only work on the Apple iPhone or iPad related devices.

properties.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_CURRENT_CONTEXT
properties.description: The view is presented using the same style as its parent window. This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad and SDK 3.2+.

properties.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_FORMSHEET
properties.description: The width and height of the presented window are smaller than those of the screen and the view is centered on the screen. If the device is in a landscape orientation and the keyboard is visible, the position of the view is adjusted upward so that the view remains visible. All uncovered areas are dimmed to prevent the user from interacting with them. This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad and SDK 3.2+.

properties.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN
properties.description: The presented window covers the screen. This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad and SDK 3.2+.

properties.name: MODAL_PRESENTATION_PAGESHEET
properties.description: The height of the presented window is set to the height of the screen and the view's width is set to the width of the screen in a portrait orientation. Any uncovered areas are dimmed to prevent the user from interacting with them. (In portrait orientations, this option is essentially the same as Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN). This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad and SDK 3.2+.

properties.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_COVER_VERTICAL
properties.description: When the window is presented, its view slides up from the bottom of the screen. On dismissal, the view slides back down. This is the default transition style. This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad.

properties.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_CROSS_DISSOLVE
properties.description: When the window is presented, the current view fades out while the new view fades in at the same time. On dismissal, a similar type of cross-fade is used to return to the original view. This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad.

properties.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_FLIP_HORIZONTAL
properties.description: When the window is presented, the current view initiates a horizontal 3D flip from right-to-left, resulting in the revealing of the new view as if it were on the back of the previous view. On dismissal, the flip occurs from left-to-right, returning to the original view. This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad.

properties.name: MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_PARTIAL_CURL
properties.description: When the window is presented, one corner of the current view curls up to reveal the modal view underneath. On dismissal, the curled up page unfurls itself back on top of the modal view. A modal view presented using this transition is itself prevented from presenting any additional modal views. This transition style is supported only if the window is presenting a Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN modal presentation style. This is currently only available currently on iPhone/iPad and SDK 3.2+.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.ActivityIndicatorStyle

properties.name: PLAIN

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.AnimationStyle
description: A set of constants for the Animation Styles used for transitions.

properties.name: CURL_DOWN
properties.description: Curl downwards during a transition animation

properties.name: CURL_UP
properties.description: Curl upwards during a transition animation

properties.name: FLIP_FROM_LEFT
properties.description: Flip from left to right during a transition animation

properties.name: FLIP_FROM_RIGHT
properties.description: Flip from right to left during a transition animation

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: No animation

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.NavigationGroup
description:
A Navigation Group implements a specialized view that manages the navigation of hierarchical content. The Navigation Group is created by the method Titanium.UI.iPhone.NavigationGroup.

A Navigation Group is very similar to Tab Bars with the exception that they do not maintain a group of windows with a interface bar at the bottom.

properties.name: anchorPoint
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the anchor point value. anchor specifies the position by which animation should occur. center is 0.5, 0.5

properties.name: animatedCenterPoint
properties.description: read-only object with x and y properties of where the view is during animation

properties.name: backgroundColor
properties.description: the background color of the view

properties.name: backgroundDisabledColor
properties.description: the disabled background color of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundDisabledImage
properties.description: the disabled background image url of the view. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedColor
properties.description: the focused background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundFocusedImage
properties.description: the focused background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundGradient
properties.description: a background gradient for the view with the properties: type,startPoint,endPoint,startRadius,endRadius,backfillStart,backfillEnd,colors.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: the background image url of the view

properties.name: backgroundLeftCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the left end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The right end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the left end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the width of the image

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.description: the selected background color of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.description: the selected background image url of the view. focusable must be true for normal views. (Android)

properties.name: backgroundTopCap
properties.description: End caps specify the portion of an image that should not be resized when an image is stretched. This technique is used to implement buttons and other resizable image-based interface elements. When a button with end caps is resized, the resizing occurs only in the middle of the button, in the region between the end caps. The end caps themselves keep their original size and appearance. This property specifies the size of the top end cap. The middle (stretchable) portion is assumed to be 1 pixel wide. The bottom end cap is therefore computed by adding the size of the top end cap and the middle portion together and then subtracting that value from the height of the image

properties.name: borderColor
properties.description: the border color of the view

properties.name: borderRadius
properties.description: the border radius of the view

properties.name: borderWidth
properties.description: the border width of the view

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: property for the view bottom position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: center
properties.description: a dictionary with properties x and y to indicate the center of the views position relative to the parent view

properties.name: focusable
properties.description: Set true if you want a view to be focusable when navigating with the trackball or D-Pad. Default: false. (Android Only)

properties.name: font-family
properties.description: the font family

properties.name: font-size
properties.description: the font size

properties.name: font-style
properties.description: the font style, either normal or italics

properties.name: font-weight
properties.description: the font weight, either normal or bold

properties.name: height
properties.description: property for the view height. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: left
properties.description: property for the view left position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: the opacity from 0.0-1.0

properties.name: right
properties.description: property for the view right position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: size
properties.description: the size of the view as a dictionary of width and height properties

properties.name: softKeyboardOnFocus
properties.description: One of Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_DEFAULT_ON_FOCUS, Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_HIDE_ON_FOCUS, or Titanium.UI.Android.SOFT_KEYBOARD_SHOW_ON_FOCUS. (Android only)

properties.name: top
properties.description: property for the view top position. This position is relative to the view's parent. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: touchEnabled
properties.description: a boolean indicating if the view should receive touch events (true, default) or forward them to peers (false)

properties.name: transform
properties.description: the transformation matrix to apply to the view

properties.name: visible
properties.description: a boolean of the visibility of the view

properties.name: width
properties.description: property for the view width. Can be either a float value or a dimension string ie 'auto' (default).

properties.name: zIndex
properties.description: the z index position relative to other sibling views

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.ProgressBarStyle
description: A set of constants for the bar styles used on the style property of Titanium.UI.ProgressBar.

properties.name: BAR
properties.description: The style of progress view that is used in a toolbar.

properties.name: DEFAULT
properties.description: he standard progress-view style. This is the default.

properties.name: PLAIN
properties.description: The standard progress-view style. Same as DEFAULT.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.RowAnimationStyle
description: A set of constants for the Animation Styles used for transition on table view rows.

properties.name: BOTTOM
properties.description: The inserted row or rows slides in from the bottom; the deleted row or rows slides out toward the bottom.

properties.name: FADE
properties.description: The inserted or deleted row or rows fades into or out of the table view.

properties.name: LEFT
properties.description: The inserted row or rows slides in from the left; the deleted row or rows slides out to the left.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: No animation is performed. The new cell value appears as if the cell had just been reloaded.

properties.name: RIGHT
properties.description: The inserted row or rows slides in from the right; the deleted row or rows slides out to the right.

properties.name: TOP
properties.description: The inserted row or rows slides in from the top; the deleted row or rows slides out toward the top.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.ScrollIndicatorStyle
description: A set of constants for the styles available for Titanium.UI.ActivityIndicator objects.

properties.name: BLACK
properties.description: A style of indicator which is black smaller than the default style. This style is good against a white content background.

properties.name: DEFAULT
properties.description: The default style of scroll indicator, which is black with a white border. This style is good against any content background.

properties.name: WHITE
properties.description: A style of indicator is white and smaller than the default style. This style is good against a black content background.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.StatusBar
description: A set of constants for the status bar style.

properties.description: The default status bar style

properties.name: GRAY
properties.description: The gray colored status bar style

properties.name: OPAQUE_BLACK
properties.description: The opaque black status bar style.

properties.name: TRANSLUCENT_BLACK
properties.description: The translucent black status bar style. This style provides some level of transparency to the device background.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.TableViewCellSelectionStyle
description: A set of constants for the style that can be used for the selectionStyle property of Titanium.UI.TableViewRow.

properties.name: BLUE
properties.description: The cell when selected has a blue background. This is the default value.

properties.name: GRAY
properties.description: Then cell when selected has a gray background.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: The cell has no distinct style for when it is selected.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.TableViewScrollPosition
description: A set of constants for the position value that can be used for the position property of Titanium.UI.TableView when invoking scrollToIndex.

properties.name: BOTTOM
properties.description: The table view scrolls the row of interest to the bottom of the visible table view.

properties.name: MIDDLE
properties.description: The table view scrolls the row of interest to the middle of the visible table view.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: The table view scrolls the row of interest to be fully visible with a minimum of movement. If the row is already fully visible, no scrolling occurs. For example, if the row is above the visible area, the behavior is identical to that specified by TOP. This is the default.

properties.name: TOP
properties.description: The table view scrolls the row of interest to the top of the visible table view.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.TableViewSeparatorStyle
description: A set of constants for the style that can be used for the separatorStyle property of Titanium.UI.TableView.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: The separator cell has no distinct style.

properties.name: SINGLE_LINE
properties.description: The separator cell has a single line running across its width. This is the default value.

name: Titanium.UI.iPhone.TableViewStyle
description: A set of constants for the style that can be used for the button style property of Titanium.UI.TableView.

properties.name: GROUPED
properties.description: A table view whose sections present distinct groups of rows. The section headers and footers do not float.

properties.name: PLAIN
properties.description: A plain table view. Any section headers or footers are displayed as inline separators and float when the table view is scrolled.

functions.name: yql
functions.description: invoke a Yahoo YQL query

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: the function to execute when the query completes. The event will contain the boolean property <tt>success</tt> if successful. If <tt>success</tt> is false, the <tt>message</tt> property will contain the error message. If <tt>success</tt> is true, the <tt>data</tt> property will contain the data payload received from the YQL.
